question:
In the recently released Global TB Report 2017 by World Health Organization (WHO), Multidrug-resistant TB (MDR-TB) has been recognised as growing threat to public health care. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. MDR-TB infection is caused by bacteria
  2. MDR-TB infection makes a person resistant to isoniazid (INH) and rifampicin (RMP) drugs used for treatment of TB
  3. As per WHO Global TB report, India has the highest number of TB cases in the world
Which of the above statements are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. MDR-TB is caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. MDR-TB infection makes a person resistant to isoniazid (INH) and rifampicin drugs which are most commonly used for treatment of TB. Second statement is correct. <u>Third statement is correct</u>. As per WHO Global TB report, India has the highest number of TB cases in the world. In 2016, there were an estimated 10.4 million new TB cases worldwide, out of which India shares the highest number of cases followed by Indonesia, China, Philippines, Pakistan, Nigeria and South Africa.
